intro: Paepalanthus minus, commonly known as the small paepalanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions with its compact growth form. Its small, yellowish flowers are often clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its unique adaptations, Paepalanthus minus is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic plant species.
